div1.p: Kellogg discusses a drug his company is investigating.

div1.head: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, March 10, 1942

opener.dateline:
GEORGE A. KELLOGG
257 CORNELISON AVENUE
JERSEY CITY, N.J.
March 10, 1942.

div1.p:
We were glad to be able to send your friend,
Dr. Darrell Crain, in Washington, D.C. one of our framed
prints of “Conquerors of Yellow Fever”.

The trip to Seattle which I mentioned had to
do with a product which a Seattle group are interested in
selling. As a specialist in arthritis you probably have a
greater than average interest in calcium metabolism. The
product just mentioned has been presented to us as a natural
calcium solution (artesian well water) containing 1.38% cal-
cium in the form of calcium chloride plus numerous mineral
elements.

I was referred to a Dr. Alice Bernheim here in
New York who was Sherman's assistant in the days when he was
doing his work on calcium and who has published somewhat ex-
tensively on the subject in the last twenty years. Dr. Bern-
stein has been using the product experimentally and told me
that it has the definite advantage of being better tolerated
by most patients than any other form of calcium.

While the Calces group make quite a point of
the trace elements included in the natural water our research
staff feel that this is pure blue sky. Of course, it is poss-
ible that the trace elements may have some bearing on the
patients' ability to tolerate calcium chloride in solution.

If I should go to Seattle I would like to stop
and talk to you and perhaps some of your associates who might
be interested. Enclosed find a label from the Calces bottle
along with a piece of their literature and a photostat of one
of Dr. Bernstein's articles. This article was written, of
course, before she had had any expxrience with the product
under discussion.

As you know, we are always interested in new
products. My interest in this one was aroused largely because
of the fact that it might involve my making a trip to Seattle
on the Company's money.

Since that time I have become interested in calcium
therapy.

Don't be surprised to find me headed in your direction
either shortly before or shortly after your projected trip to
Buffalo on March 28th.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, George A. Kellogg Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
